remarks: An index at which a polynomial is zero, cannot be its degree. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 23-Mar-2015.)
statement:
deg1z.d $e |- D = ( deg1 ` R ) $.
deg1z.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
deg1z.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` P ) $.
deg1nn0cl.b $e |- B = ( Base ` P ) $.
deg1ldg.y $e |- Y = ( 0g ` R ) $.
deg1ldg.a $e |- A = ( coe1 ` F ) $.
deg1ldgn.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. Ring ) $.
deg1ldgn.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. B ) $.
deg1ldgn.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. NN0 ) $.
deg1ldgn.e $e |- ( ph -> ( A ` X ) = Y ) $.
deg1ldgn $p |- ( ph -> ( D ` F ) =/= X ) $.
